title: Cryptocurrency’s Energy Consumption Problem - Rocky Mountain Institute
summary:
Cryptocurrency's energy consumption problem is a significant issue, with Bitcoin alone consuming over 127 terawatt-hours of electricity per year, more than many countries. The crypto industry is estimated to emit 25-50 million tons of CO2 annually, on par with the annual emissions from diesel fuel used by US railroads. To address this problem, Rocky Mountain Institute (RMI) has played a role in initial decarbonization efforts in the crypto industry, but will focus on decarbonizing the grid rather than crypto transactions moving forward.

Challenges with decarbonizing the crypto industry include:

1. Proof-of-work energy usage: Bitcoin is the only major currency that uses proof-of-work mining, which is an inevitable consequence of its algorithms and results in high energy usage.
2. Price volatility: As prices are high, miners may be willing to power their operations with clean electricity, but as prices come down, smaller profit margins mean industry players are likely to seek out the cheapest electricity possible, which may not always be the cleanest.

title: Is Solana Following Ethereum’s Early Days? Top Trader Compares SOL and ETH, Updates Stance on Crypto Markets - The Daily Hodl
summary: A popular trader on Twitter, Cantering Clark, has compared the price action of Solana (SOL) to that of Ethereum (ETH) in 2018, suggesting that SOL may be following ETH's early growth stages. Clark's chart shows similarities in the way both assets bounced off a support level multiple times before collapsing and then rebounding. He predicts a similar move for SOL, suggesting a rally to around $462 before the next bear market. Clark also warns of a potential correction in the near term, potentially triggered by poor earnings reports or other macroeconomic announcements. He notes that BTC lacks liquidity in a certain price range, which could lead to price falls.

title: Ethereum 2.0: What Exactly is this New Blockchain Version? - Crypto Times
summary:
Ethereum 2.0 is an upgraded version of the Ethereum network that uses a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism instead of the previous proof-of-work (PoW) model. The upgrade aims to improve the network's scalability, security, and decentralization. It includes several phases, including:

1. Beacon Chain: Introduced in 2020, this phase allowed users to stake their ETH and become validators.
2. Phase 1: Launched in mid-2022, this phase merged the Mainnet into the Beacon Chain, switching the consensus mechanism from PoW to PoS. Miners were expected to take their holdings and stake them to evolve into validators.
3. Phase 2: This phase introduced Ethereum Web Assembly (eWASM), designed to make the Ethereum 1.0 network more efficient.
4. Phase 3: A miscellaneous stage for any extra upgrades needed before the complete transition to Ethereum 2.0 in 2023.

title: Ethereum Name Service- Everything You Need to Know About the Latest Trends & Milestones - Yahoo Entertainment
summary:
The Ethereum Name Service (ENS) has experienced significant growth in 2022, with record numbers of new users, name registrations, and revenue. The service has also seen an increase in trends and categories, with new marketplaces and tools emerging to provide support. ENS Labs, the latest iteration of the ENS domain service, has been renamed and is now focused on expanding its global reach and adoption.

Some of the key trends and milestones in the ENS ecosystem include:

1. New trends and categories: ENS has seen an increase in new trends and categories, such as NFTs, gaming, and decentralized finance (DeFi).
2. Record numbers of new users and name registrations: ENS has experienced a surge in new users and name registrations, with over 2 million names created in 2022.
3. Increased revenue: ENS has seen a significant increase in revenue, with over $72 million spent on registrations and renewals in 2022.
4. Expansion of marketplaces and tools: ENS Labs

title: 60% of investors believe ETH has better growth potential than BTC – CoinShares survey reveals - CryptoSlate
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

60% of investors believe Ethereum (ETH) has better growth potential than Bitcoin (BTC), according to a CoinShares survey. The survey found that 60% of respondents prefer ETH, while only 30% prefer BTC. The survey included 43 investors managing $390 billion in assets. The results show a significant increase in the number of investors investing in digital assets, with 1.1% of portfolios now dedicated to them, up from 0.7% last year. Hedge funds have increased their investments in digital assets, while institutional investors have reduced theirs.

title: OpenSea sees a spike in Ethereum-based NFT sales, thanks to these factors - AMBCrypto News
summary: OpenSea, a leading NFT marketplace, has seen a significant increase in Ethereum-based NFT sales, with a 21% increase in sales volume and a 62% increase in transactions count in the last 30 days. The growth is attributed to a surge in the number of Ethereum-based NFTs sold on the platform, with 1.03 million sold in the last 28 days. Ethereum-based NFTs account for the most sales in the NFT vertical of the crypto ecosystem, with $745 million in sales in the last 30 days. Blue Chip NFTs, which are of high quality and value, have grown in value since the start of the year, with the Blue Chip Index climbing by 6%.

title: ENS domains mimicking major exchanges' wallets indicate a new type of scam - crypto.news
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

ENS domains are decentralized domain name service on ethereum blockchain. Scammers are creating ENS domains mimicking major exchanges' wallets, possibly to intercept payments. The scammers bought 50 ENS domains in March 2022 for over $3,000, but failed to mislead any network participant. The addresses involved were internal exchange addresses, and transactions were sent to whitelisted addresses, making it unlikely that funds were mistakenly sent. Despite this, the ENS domains will expire in about four years, leaving time for potential scams.

title: Premier League Signs NFT Deal With This Ethereum-based Game - CoinGape
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Premier League signs multi-year deal with Sorare, a $4.3B fantasy soccer game on Ethereum. Players can buy, sell, and use officially licensed NFTs of Premier League players in fantasy matches. Sorare adds two new features: league-specific player cards and financial fair play to prevent all-star teams. The deal comes after a long negotiation and previous failed bid by ConsenSys. Sorare's NFT collection is the third largest in the world, with over $500M in card trades last year. The partnership is part of a growing trend of sports leagues partnering with crypto platforms.

title: BudBlockz (BLUNT) Is Getting More Traction and Crypto Experts Compare It to Ethereum (ETH) - DailyCoin
summary: BudBlockz, a new cryptocurrency, is gaining traction and comparisons are being made to Ethereum. BudBlockz aims to be the world's first e-commerce platform for cannabis trading, and its token, BLUNT, is currently available for presale. The platform plans to unite the cannabis industry through decentralized technologies and provide opportunities for investment and trading in top-quality products. BudBlockz is also offering Ganja Guruz NFTs for fractional ownership in cannabis enterprises. Ethereum is also showing signs of recovery in 2023, with experts predicting it may soon cross the $2,000 mark. The article concludes that BudBlockz may soon compete with top-ranked altcoins and benefit investors in the long term.

title: Portal Fantasy, the Magical Pixel RPG to be Live on Ethereum (ETH) and Avalanche (AVAX) in 2023 - U.Today
summary: Portal Fantasy is a new blockchain-based RPG game set to launch in 2023 on the Ethereum and Avalanche networks. The game offers a player-first approach and features two unique playstyles: Heroes can explore and battle in magical worlds, while Architects can create and customize their own worlds. The game has a focus on inclusivity and sustainability, with a balanced economy and no mechanism for directly extracting value from players. The game has backing from reputable VCs and aims to push the boundaries of play-to-earn gaming.

title: Ethereum Network Usage Skyrockets As ETH Hits Two-Month High - Bitcoinist
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum network usage has skyrocketed as the price of ETH reaches a two-month high. On-chain activity has set a new high, with over 1 million ETH transferred daily and a record 92.5 million addresses on the network. Ethereum has seen significant growth in unique addresses, daily verified smart contracts, and deflationary issuance. Despite a recent retracement, ETH has increased over 30% in the past 30 days and is currently trading at $1,573.
